sphaerospora angulata: A type of freshwater parasitic microorganism that is characterized by its ability to cause mild kidney damage and inflammation in certain fish species, while its microscopic features are difficult to distinguish from those of a closely related species.

sbi: Acute inflammatory responses affecting the gas-filled organs of juvenile fish, often triggered by the presence of parasitic microparasites.
